short_description: This function examines a decision forest model.
long_description: This function analyze the model from random forest and outputs a list of which variables are used at which levels in each of the decision trees in the model along with the variable importance.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the model data from forest.drive.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the model data from forest_drive.

argument_clauses.name: NumLevels
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies number of levels to analyze and the default value is 5.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies number of levels to analyze and the default value is 5.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
